chrome_web_request

Top-Level Variables
web_request: ChromeWebRequest
Classes
ChromeWebRequest

Use the chrome.webRequest API to observe and analyze traffic and to intercept, block, or modify requests in-flight.

Top-Level Variables

static final ChromeWebRequest web_request

Class ChromeWebRequest

Fields

Fields

final dynamic MAX_HANDLER_BEHAVIOR_CHANGED_CALLS_PER_10_MINUTES
final Stream onAuthRequired
final Stream onBeforeRedirect
final Stream onBeforeRequest
final Stream onBeforeSendHeaders
final Stream onCompleted
final Stream onErrorOccurred
final Stream onHeadersReceived
final Stream onResponseStarted
final Stream onSendHeaders

Getters and Setters

dynamic get MAX_HANDLER_BEHAVIOR_CHANGED_CALLS_PER_10_MINUTES

The maximum number of times that handlerBehaviorChanged can be called per 10 minute sustained interval. handlerBehaviorChanged is an expensive function call that shouldn't be called often.

Stream<dynamic> get onAuthRequired

Fired when an authentication failure is received. The listener has three options: it can provide authentication credentials, it can cancel the request and display the error page, or it can take no action on the challenge. If bad user credentials are provided, this may be called multiple times for the same request.

Stream<dynamic> get onBeforeRedirect

Fired when a server-initiated redirect is about to occur.

Stream<dynamic> get onBeforeRequest

Fired when a request is about to occur.

Stream<dynamic> get onBeforeSendHeaders

Fired before sending an HTTP request, once the request headers are available. This may occur after a TCP connection is made to the server, but before any HTTP data is sent.

Stream<dynamic> get onCompleted

Fired when a request is completed.

Stream<dynamic> get onErrorOccurred

Fired when an error occurs.

Stream<dynamic> get onHeadersReceived

Fired when HTTP response headers of a request have been received.

Stream<dynamic> get onResponseStarted

Fired when the first byte of the response body is received. For HTTP requests, this means that the status line and response headers are available.

Stream<dynamic> get onSendHeaders

Fired just before a request is going to be sent to the server (modifications of previous onBeforeSendHeaders callbacks are visible by the time onSendHeaders is fired).

Methods

void handlerBehaviorChanged(dynamic callback)

Needs to be called when the behavior of the webRequest handlers has changed to prevent incorrect handling due to caching. This function call is expensive. Don't call it often.
